intro: Hieracium luculentorum, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy stems, which help it retain moisture in dry environments. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Hieracium luculentorum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun.
